required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Mobile Health Obesity Wellness Intervention in Rural Older Adults (MOWI): Research Pilot

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this study is to conduct a program of pilot research aimed at developing and evaluating a technology-assisted wellness intervention for older adults with obesity.

detailed_description.textblock:
The national epidemic of obesity is also affecting older adults, and is associated with an increased risk of disability, nursing home placement and early mortality. Conventional weight loss programs have the potential to reduce body fat, but are difficult to access for older obese adults due to transportation and mobility challenges. The overarching goal of this study is to conduct a program of pilot research aimed at developing and evaluating a technology assisted wellness intervention for older adults with obesity.
Study Timeline:
September 2017 to June 2018:
Goal: Conduct a pilot study of improving weight and physical function in older adults with obesity. An mHealth Obesity Wellness Intervention (MOWI) will integrate Amulet with a weekly individual dietician-led nutritional session, along with twice weekly physical therapist led group exercise session.
Participation Duration: Three times weekly for 3 months

primary_outcome.description: Assessed by a Jamar dynamometer. Sensor-based Thera-bands will measure data on strength change.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 4 weeks, 8 weeks, 12 weeks and 12-weeks post-study
primary_outcome.description: STS measures lower limb strength (minimal change 2.3 s).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 4 weeks, 8 weeks, 12 weeks and 12-weeks post-study
primary_outcome.description: A surrogate for cardiovascular fitness that measures distance (normal 400-700m) related to function. A clinically important difference is 50-55m

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 4 weeks, 8 weeks, 12 weeks and 12-weeks post-study
primary_outcome.description: Gait speed is measured by the time it takes to walk 20 meters. Gait speed predicts disability and mortality (significant change 0.1 m/s).

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Late-Life Function and Disability Instrument (LLFDI)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 4 weeks, 8 weeks, 12 weeks and 12-weeks post-study
primary_outcome.description: LLFDI consists of a 32-item function and 16-item disability (life-task) scales that correlate with gait speed and lower limb function.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 4 weeks, 8 weeks, 12 weeks and 12-weeks post-study
secondary_outcome.description: Patient Activation Measure (PAM) assesses knowledge, confidence and skill for managing health and grouped into 4 levels revealing insights into attitudes, motivators, behaviors & outcomes.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 4 weeks, 8 weeks, 12 weeks and 12-weeks post-study
secondary_outcome.description: Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information Systems (PROMIS) Global Short Form. PROMIS is a 10-item instrument capturing physical, mental and social aspects of quality of life having undergone quantitative appraisal and is non-proprietary.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 4 weeks, 8 weeks, 12 weeks and 12-weeks post-study

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in body mass index (BMI) in kg/m^2
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 4 weeks, 8 weeks, 12 weeks and 12-weeks post-study
secondary_outcome.description: Change in body mass index (BMI) in kg/m^2

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in waist and hip circumference in cm
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 4 weeks, 8 weeks, 12 weeks and 12-weeks post-study
secondary_outcome.description: Change in waist and hip circumference in cm

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 4 weeks, 8 weeks, 12 weeks and 12-weeks post-study
secondary_outcome.description: Amulet will assess activity type, steps, and distance.

secondary_outcome.measure: Community Healthy Activities Model Program for Seniors Physical Activity Questionnaire (CHAMPS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 4 weeks, 8 weeks, 12 weeks and 12-weeks post-study
secondary_outcome.description: CHAMPS is a self-reported tool in older adults that assesses activity levels and types
Lean fat, visceral fat and appendicular lean mass
Inflammatory cytokines, bone turnover, energy metabolism, homeostasis

arm_group.description: Develop and refine a mHealth obesity wellness intervention (MOWI) for rural, older, obese adults without the use of Amulet technology.
Develop and refine a mHealth obesity wellness intervention (MOWI) for rural, older, obese adults with the use of Amulet and Fitbit technology.
Weight loss maintenance for 6-months post-intervention to assess feasibility of once-per month group-based psychosocial skills for weight management.
Develop and refine a mHealth obesity wellness intervention (MOWI) for rural, older, obese adults with the use of Amulet and Fitbit technology augmented by whey protein.
Develop and refine a mHealth obesity wellness intervention (MOWI) for rural, older, obese adults with the use of Fitbit technology.
Develop and refine a mHealth obesity wellness intervention (MOWI) for rural, older, obese adults with the use of Fitbit technology augmented by whey protein.

intervention.description: The mHealth Obesity Wellness Intervention (MOWI) will be informed by the previous Aim (Aim 1) of this proposal. It will consist of a 12-week, 3x/week program of: weekly nutrition counseling; 2x/week group exercise visits. A dietician and physical therapist will lead the in-person sessions. Two waves of 8 individuals each will be assessed at 0, 4, 8 and 12 weeks.

The mHealth Obesity Wellness Intervention (MOWI) will be informed by the previous Aim (Aim 1) of this proposal. It will consist of a 12-week, 3x/week program of: weekly nutrition counseling; 2x/week group exercise visits; and Amulet to monitor activity. A dietician and physical therapist will lead the in-person sessions. Two waves of 8 individuals each will be assessed at 0, 4, 8 and 12 weeks and will also be given Amulet to measure steps, activity type, duration and distance.

The MOWI weight loss maintenance group is made up of study participants who have completed the 12-week MOWI intervention (Aim 2A or Aim 2B). It will consist of 1x/month 90-minute CBT-based group meetings with health coach. Sessions will focus on development of psychosocial skills for weight management success.

The mHealth Obesity Wellness Intervention (MOWI) will be informed by the previous Aim (Aim 1) of this proposal. It will consist of a 12-week, 3x/week program of: weekly nutrition counseling; 2x/week group exercise visits; and Amulet/Fitbit to monitor activity. A dietician and physical therapist will lead the in-person sessions. Two waves of 8 individuals each will be assessed at 0, 4, 8 and 12 weeks and will also be given Amulet to measure steps, activity type, duration and distance. We will provide whey protein 3x/week after exercise sessions.

The mHealth Obesity Wellness Intervention (MOWI) will be informed by the previous Aim (Aim 1) of this proposal. It will consist of a 12-week, 3x/week program of: weekly nutrition counseling; 2x/week group exercise visits; and Fitbit to monitor activity. A dietician and physical therapist will lead the in-person sessions. Two waves of 8 individuals each will be assessed at 0, 4, 8 and 12 weeks and will also be given Amulet to measure steps, activity type, duration and distance.

The mHealth Obesity Wellness Intervention (MOWI) will be informed by the previous Aim (Aim 1) of this proposal. It will consist of a 12-week, 3x/week program of: weekly nutrition counseling; 2x/week group exercise visits; and Fitbit to monitor activity. A dietician and physical therapist will lead the in-person sessions. Two waves of 8 individuals each will be assessed at 0, 4, 8 and 12 weeks and will also be given Amulet to measure steps, activity type, duration and distance. We will provide whey protein 3x/week after exercise sessions.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
All Aims:
- Age ≥65 years
- Body Mass Index (BMI) ≥ 30kg/m^2
- Waist circumference ≥88cm in females or ≥102cm in males
Aims 2 & 3:
- Have Wi-Fi high speed internet
- Able to obtain medical clearance from doctor
- Have less than a 5% weight loss in past 6 months
- No advanced co-morbidity
- No exercise restrictions
- Not involved in other research studies that may interfere with participation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Severe mental or life-threatening illness
- Dementia
- Substance use
- History of bariatric surgery
- Suicidal ideation
- Unable to perform measures
- Reside in nursing home
- No advanced co-morbidity
- No exercise restrictions
- Not involved in other research studies that may interfere with participation

overall_official.affiliation: Dartmouth-Hitchcock Medical Center / Dartmouth Medical School
